reviews.text: Half decent station in Charlton with basic facilities and all. Train services to London, Woolwich and Dartford is basic enough but it works for the most part. It's less grim than the likes of Woolwich Dockyard to say the least.

Absolutely useless employees here, and very limited services. Most of their information boards are out of date because of the September and October timetable changes. You'd be better off going to Lewisham using the DLR services at Greenwich.

Basic station and signs can be down quite often with cancelled trains but not the stations fault. There is a ticket booth, outside ticket machine, outside toilets (I’ve never used), a coffee stall (Ben Jamal) which is handy in the morning. Quite like the free book section in the station. Could do with a few more benches the length of the platform and covered bench area needs a revamp. 
Trains to Charing x, Cannon Street and now handily through st Pancras. Convenient for central London but need to plan accordingly.
As good as any other suburban railway station connected to London bridge. The trains come, pick up people, and go as accurately as the National Rail people run them.
